channel.title: French Shootings - Gunman shot dead
channel.description:
A police siege in the French city of Toulouse has ended with a man suspected of killing seven people now dead, sources tell French media, although there is no official confirmation yet. Police had entered the flat where Mohammed Merah was holed up after a siege that lasted more than a day. Police sources told AFP that three officers had been wounded, one seriously, in the assault. Merah, 23, was suspected of killing seven people in three separate attacks. Earlier Interior Minister Claude Gueant said Merah had wanted to die "with weapons in hand" and there had been no contact with him overnight. Before the assault took place, Mr Gueant said it was unclear whether Merah was still alive. However, police met resistance as they began the assault shortly after 09:30 GMT.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-17473207 Looks like the French police lost their patience and stormed his flat.

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:6, topic:437153”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=539867.msg3952643#msg3952643 date=1332434146]
France is known for very strict gun-control laws, it’s very hard to impossible to own a gun there, so obviously gun control laws work right? Insane crazy people that want to hurt others can’t get their hands on them, right? Then how did this happen?
[/quote]

If shootings like this happen on a daily basis, then you could be right. But this is an incident. It’s not clear yet where he got his gun, but I bet he got it illegally. I for one never said insane people can get their hands on guns. Most illegal arms dealers don’t do a background check when they are selling a gun.

A while ago a young Dutch guy started shooting in a shopping mall. A few people died. His weapons were legal.[/quote]

I’m sure the gun(s) were illegal. That is one of my points, there is no way to pass laws to keep criminals from getting ahold of illegal guns, if criminals obeyed laws, they wouldn’t be criminals. And that is what the whole concept of gun-control is based around.

France is known for very strict gun-control laws, it’s very hard to impossible to own a gun there, so obviously gun control laws work right? Insane crazy people that want to hurt others can’t get their hands on them, right? Then how did this happen?

Also, I’d like to address a possible inconsistency in the article:

Mr Molins said a Colt 45 handgun was found next to his body, and he estimated that Merah had fired 30 bullets as the commandos broke in.
A standard Colt 1911 .45ACP magazine holds 7 rounds, you can buy them that hold 8 rounds though, so even with the best case scenario, that guy went through 3-4 magazine reloads WHILE the commandos were breaking in? It must have been the slowest break in ever. I doubt that this was possible.
